author: Daniel Greene
description:
Audible has long claimed to have fixed its notorious return issue — the policy that allowed listeners to exploit loopholes and cost authors their royalties. But after digging deeper into the ecosystem, I’ve found a serious exploit that proves the problem was never truly solved.
Previous videos: https://youtu.be/2BJIZA_OpDw 
Here is Robin's petition: https://chng.it/mdgp8mZffb 
If you’d like to sign up to libro fm and support the channel, you can do so here: https://libro.fm/referral?rf_code=lfm456628

In this video, we’ll break down how the Kindle + Audible bundle loophole still allows customers to get audiobooks for drastically reduced prices — while authors and publishers eat the cost. This is not just a bug; it’s a systemic flaw in how Audible’s purchasing and return systems interact.

My Books:
Neon Ghosts: A Witch's Sin Hardcover: https://shop.wraithmarked.com/collections/standard-editions-1/products/neon-ghosts-a-witchs-sin-hardcover
Breach of Peace: https://tinyurl.com/BoPTLT
R
title: I Found ANOTHER Audible Return Exploit... yes, really
